com.basecamp.turbolinks

Class TurbolinksSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basecamp.turbolinks.TurbolinksSession

  • public class TurbolinksSession
extends java.lang.Object

    The main concrete class to use Turbolinks 5 in your app.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      REQUIRED A TurbolinksAdapter implementation is required so that callbacks during the Turbolinks event lifecycle can be passed back to your app.

    • Method Detail

      • getNew

        public static TurbolinksSession getNew(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a brand new TurbolinksSession that the calling application will be responsible for managing.
        Parameters:
        context - Any Android context.
        Returns:
        TurbolinksSession to be managed by the calling application.

      • getDefault

        public static TurbolinksSession getDefault(android.content.Context context)
        Convenience method that returns a default TurbolinksSession. This is useful for when an app only needs one instance of a TurbolinksSession.
        Parameters:
        context - Any Android context.
        Returns:
        The default, static instance of a TurbolinksSession, guaranteed to not be null.

      • resetDefault

        public static void resetDefault()
        Resets the default TurbolinksSession instance to null in case you want a fresh session.

      • setDebugLoggingEnabled

        public static void setDebugLoggingEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Tells the logger whether to allow logging in debug mode.

        Parameters:
        enabled - If true debug logging is enabled.

      • activity

        public TurbolinksSession activity(android.app.Activity activity)

        REQUIRED Turbolinks requires a context for a variety of uses, and for maximum clarity we ask for an Activity context instead of a generic one. (On occassion, we've run into WebView bugs where an Activity is the only fix).

        It's best to pass a new activity to Turbolinks for each new visit for clarity. This ensures there is a one-to-one relationship maintained between internal activity IDs and visit IDs.

        Parameters:
        activity - An Android Activity, one per visit.
        Returns:
        The TurbolinksSession to continue the chained calls.

      • adapter

        public TurbolinksSession adapter(TurbolinksAdapter turbolinksAdapter)

        REQUIRED A TurbolinksAdapter implementation is required so that callbacks during the Turbolinks event lifecycle can be passed back to your app.

        Parameters:
        turbolinksAdapter - Any class that implements TurbolinksAdapter.
        Returns:
        The TurbolinksSession to continue the chained calls.

      • view

        public TurbolinksSession view(TurbolinksView turbolinksView)

        REQUIRED A TurbolinksView object that's been inflated in a custom layout is required so the library can manage various view-related tasks: attaching/detaching the internal webView, showing/hiding a progress loading view, etc.

        Parameters:
        turbolinksView - An inflated TurbolinksView from your custom layout.
        Returns:
        The TurbolinksSession to continue the chained calls.

      • visit

        public void visit(java.lang.String location)

        REQUIRED Executes a Turbolinks visit. Must be called at the end of the chain -- all required parameters will first be validated before firing.

        Parameters:
        location - The URL to visit.

      • progressView

        public TurbolinksSession progressView(android.view.View progressView,
                                      int progressIndicatorResId,
                                      int progressIndicatorDelay)

        Optional This will override the default progress view/progress indicator that's provided out of the box. This allows you to customize how you want the progress view to look while pages are loading.

        Parameters:
        progressView - A custom progressView object.
        progressIndicatorResId - The resource ID of a progressIndicator object inside the progressView.
        progressIndicatorDelay - The delay, in milliseconds, before the progress indicator should be displayed inside the progress view (default is 500 ms).
        Returns:
        The TurbolinksSession to continue the chained calls.

      • restoreWithCachedSnapshot

        public TurbolinksSession restoreWithCachedSnapshot(boolean restoreWithCachedSnapshot)

        Optional By default Turbolinks will "advance" to the next page and scroll position will not be restored. Optionally calling this method allows you to set the behavior on a per-visitbasis. This will be reset to "false" after each visit.

        Parameters:
        restoreWithCachedSnapshot - If true, will restore scroll position. If false, will not restore scroll position.
        Returns:
        The TurbolinksSession to continue the chained calls.

      • visitProposedToLocationWithAction

        public void visitProposedToLocationWithAction(java.lang.String location,
                                              java.lang.String action)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks when a new visit is initiated from a webView link.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        location - URL to be visited.
        action - Whether to treat the request as an advance (navigating forward) or a replace (back).

      • visitStarted

        public void visitStarted(java.lang.String visitIdentifier,
                         boolean visitHasCachedSnapshot)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks when a new visit has just started.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.
        visitHasCachedSnapshot - Whether the visit has a cached snapshot available.

      • visitRequestCompleted

        public void visitRequestCompleted(java.lang.String visitIdentifier)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks when the HTTP request has been completed.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.

      • visitRequestFailedWithStatusCode

        public void visitRequestFailedWithStatusCode(java.lang.String visitIdentifier,
                                             int statusCode)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks when the HTTP request has failed.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.
        statusCode - The HTTP status code that caused the failure.

      • visitRendered

        public void visitRendered(java.lang.String visitIdentifier)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks once the page has been fully rendered in the webView.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.

      • visitCompleted

        public void visitCompleted(java.lang.String visitIdentifier,
                           java.lang.String restorationIdentifier)

        JavascriptInterface only Called by Turbolinks when the visit is fully completed -- request successful and page rendered.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.
        restorationIdentifier - A unique identifier for restoring the page and scroll position from cache.

      • pageInvalidated

        public void pageInvalidated()

        JavascriptInterface only Called when Turbolinks detects that the page being visited has been invalidated, typically by new resources in the the page HEAD.

        Warning: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. you should never call this directly as it could lead to unintended behavior.

      • hideProgressView

        public void hideProgressView(java.lang.String visitIdentifier)

        JavascriptInterface only Hides the progress view when the page is fully rendered.

        Note: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. For all practical purposes, you should never call this directly.

        Parameters:
        visitIdentifier - A unique identifier for the visit.

      • setTurbolinksIsReady

        public void setTurbolinksIsReady(boolean turbolinksIsReady)

        JavascriptInterface only Sets internal flags that indicate whether Turbolinks in the webView is ready for use.

        Note: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. For all practical purposes, you should never call this directly.

        Parameters:
        turbolinksIsReady - The Javascript bridge checks the current page for Turbolinks, and sends the results of that check here.

      • turbolinksDoesNotExist

        public void turbolinksDoesNotExist()

        JavascriptInterface only Handles the error condition when reaching a page without Turbolinks.

        Note: This method is public so it can be used as a Javascript Interface. For all practical purposes, you should never call this directly.

      • addJavascriptInterface

        public void addJavascriptInterface(java.lang.Object object,
                                   java.lang.String name)

        Provides the ability to add an arbitrary number of custom Javascript Interfaces to the built-in Turbolinks webView.

        Parameters:
        object - The object with annotated JavascriptInterface methods
        name - The unique name for the interface (must not use the reserved name "TurbolinksNative")

      • getActivity

        public android.app.Activity getActivity()

        Returns the activity attached to the Turbolinks call.

        Returns:
        The attached activity.

      • getWebView

        public android.webkit.WebView getWebView()

        Returns the internal WebView used by Turbolinks.

        Returns:
        The WebView used by Turbolinks.

      • resetToColdBoot

        public void resetToColdBoot()

        Resets the TurbolinksSession to go through the full cold booting sequence (full page load) on the next Turbolinks visit.

      • runJavascript

        public void runJavascript(java.lang.String functionName,
                          java.lang.Object... params)

        Runs a Javascript function with any number of arbitrary params in the Turbolinks webView.

        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the function, without any parenthesis or params
        params - A comma delimited list of params. Params will be automatically JSONified.

      • runJavascriptRaw

        public void runJavascriptRaw(java.lang.String rawJavascript)

        Runs raw Javascript in webView. Simply wraps the loadUrl("javascript: methodName()") call.

        Parameters:
        rawJavascript - The full Javascript string that will be executed by the WebView.

      • setScreenshotsEnabled

        public void setScreenshotsEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Determines whether screenshots are displayed (instead of a progress view) when resuming an activity. Default is true.

        Parameters:
        enabled - If true automatic screenshotting is enabled.

      • setPullToRefreshEnabled

        public void setPullToRefreshEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Determines whether WebViews can be refreshed by pulling/swiping from the top of the WebView. Default is true.

        Parameters:
        enabled - If true pulling to refresh the WebView is enabled

      • turbolinksIsReady

        public boolean turbolinksIsReady()

        Provides the status of whether Turbolinks is initialized and ready for use.

        Returns:
        True if Turbolinks has been fully loaded and detected on the page.

      • visitLocationWithAction

        public void visitLocationWithAction(java.lang.String location,
                                    java.lang.String action)

        A convenience method to fire a Turbolinks visit manually.

        Parameters:
        location - URL to visit.
        action - Whether to treat the request as an advance (navigating forward) or a replace (back).

      • canChildScrollUp

        public boolean canChildScrollUp()

        Determines if the user can scroll up, or if the WebView is at the top

        Returns:
        True if the WebView can be scrolled up. False if the WebView is at the top.
